1_1H8x2Aeu28Lnj6vhXFNZ32kpvGS6dnqWGA.body:
> [alaric](#comment_1_1HiyP7AD74uGuGBZLqhcmfQgwu5VC8nnYY): I grew up during the "wild west" of the internet - No censorship, constant discoveries and new developments every day. ZeroNet feels like a resurgence of those times. 
> Yes, it can feel dead and stagnant sometimes, but it's new. Many people have already pointed out the benefits of P2P web and over time it'll grow more popular. I believe the biggest surge of users will come from those who are looking for a new place to find torrentable content. 
> We'll get there guys. In the meantime, just enjoy Internet 2.0.

What was the kind of content that kept you coming back?
